article.headline: Southern Miss 66, TCU 64
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Jason Forte gave Larry Eustachy a memorable ending to his otherwise miserable first season at Southern Mississippi. Forte's basket with 2 seconds lifted the Golden Eagles to a season-ending 66-64 upset of TCU on Saturday. "It's almost amazing that you can get them to play that hard," Eustachy said. "That's the hardest we've played all season, and it was a game where we had nothing to play for. I give them credit for that. I made it very clear that this was a huge game for me." The Golden Eagles (11-17, 2-14 Conference USA) entered losers of nine straight and 15 of 16, and didn't qualify for the 12-team league tournament -- certainly not the way Eustachy, the former national coach of the year at Iowa State, wanted his first season in Hattiesburg to go. But Southern Miss won their finale with defense and Forte's opportunism. With the score tied at 64 and TCU holding for the final shot, Southern Miss senior Dante Stiggers hounded Corey Santee into a five-second violation. Southern Miss got the ball back, and Rashaad Carruth's shot missed. But Forte grabbed the rebound and scored in the final seconds to give the Golden Eagles an improbable lead. A desperation heave at the buzzer from TCU's Aaron Curtis failed to draw iron. Michael Ford had 19 points to lead Southern Miss. Senior David Haywood had 11 points and 10 rebounds in his final game, and Jarekus Singleton added 10 points before breaking his nose for the Golden Eagles. "Looking back on the season that was the best way we could have ended it," Haywood said. Carruth tied the game with a 3-pointer with 32 seconds remaining. Last-place Southern Miss -- with a defection-depleted roster of just eight players -- shot 40 percent from the field in the stunner. Two key players have left the team since January. "They could have laid down a long time ago, but they kept coming every day and practicing hard," Eustachy said of seniors Stiggers and Haywood. "They won't leave here with a championship ring, but they are a big part of what we are building." Santee had 15 points and Marcus Shropshire added 14 for TCU (18-12, 8-8). Curtis added 10 points for the Horned Frogs, who are seeded eighth in the league tournament and will play ninth-seeded Marquette in the opener Wednesday. TCU has lost four of five road games since winning at Memphis on Jan. 15. Southern Miss outrebounded TCU 40-39 despite playing stretches of the game with five guards.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
